parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Detection

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Return a list of dead units including agents. Dead unit might be inside vehicle.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''allDeadMen'''

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>{ deleteVehicle _x } forEach allDeadMen;
</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[allDead]], [[allUnits]], [[allGroups]], [[playableUnits]], [[switchableUnits]], [[units]], [[vehicles]], [[allCurators]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 17 Oct, 2009</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Pierre MGI|Pierre MGI]]<dd class="note">

As dead men are civilian side, don't try to count them with {side _x isEqualTo EAST} count allDeadMen; result will always be 0.<br>
Use the configfile "side" instead:<br>
0 = [] spawn {while {true} do {sleep 0.1;<br> _westScore = {getNumber (configfile >> "CfgVehicles" >> typeOf _x >> "side") == 0} count allDeadMen;<br> hintSilent format ["East killed: %1",_westScore]};};<br>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl></root>
